brief: I completed my bachelor's degree in nuclear engineering at Texas A&M with the highest honor. During these years, I received Jeff W Simmons'85 Scholarship, Dean's Honor Award, Adams Family Scholarship and Undergraduate Summer Research Grant.

Fascinated by the purity and rigor of mathematics, I started to pursue the transport theory which is the most mathematically-intensive area related to nuclear, and eventually turned to mathematics in my master's study.
I earned my master's degree from Texas A&M, an institute with globally reputed functional analysis.

Though my degree comes from the traditional track emphasizing the theoretical and fundamental part of mathematics, I spent quite an amount of time in numerical PDEs and the particle transport theory while I was working at the Center for Large-Scale Scientific Simulations.
This program is a milestone on my journey from an engineer to an applied mathematician. After graduation, I am pursuing research in statistics and optimization.

The Front End Web Development TechDegree program is lauched by TreeHouse, an online education organization. It consists of 28 courses, 140 quizzes, 197 challenges, 9 projects and a proctored final exam.
The program covers HTML, CSS, animations, Sass, JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX, Bootstrap, SVGs, responsive designs, web accessibility, performance optimization, audio and video, and so on.
I am completing the program soon.

I am currently in the master's program of GaTech. Though I had a lot of programming experience in computational math/physics, this program has been enriching me by the systematic methodologies of computer science.

Having gained abundant knowledge in software engineering, machine learning, databases and Android development from the program, I will also take courses in artificial intelligence, computer photography, computer vision, algorithms and operating system in the future.
